qas.question: Who invented the hydrogen filled balloons?
What year was hydrogen filled balloons invented?
what were the hydrogen lifted airships called?
In what year did the first zeppelin make flight?

context: The first hydrogen-filled balloon was invented by <a0_0>Jacques Charles<a0_0/> in <a1_0>1783<a1_0/>. Hydrogen provided the lift for the first reliable form of air-travel following the 1852 invention of the first hydrogen-lifted airship by Henri Giffard. German count Ferdinand von Zeppelin promoted the idea of rigid airships lifted by hydrogen that later were called <a2_0>Zeppelins<a2_0/>; the first of which had its maiden flight in <a3_0>1900<a3_0/>. Regularly scheduled flights started in 1910 and by the outbreak of World War I in August 1914, they had carried 35,000 passengers without a serious incident. Hydrogen-lifted airships were used as observation platforms and bombers during the war.
